display.label: Hubspot
display.description: Manage objects and associations in the Hubspot CRM platform

connections.label: Hubspot OAuth 2.0
connections.comments: Authenticate requests to Hubspot using values obtained from the developer console.

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for Hubspot
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for Hubspot
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: A space-delimited set of one or more scopes to get the user's permission to access.
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Provide the Client Id you received from the Hubspot Developer Console.
inputs.label: Client ID

inputs.comments: Provide the Client Secret you received from the Hubspot Developer Console.
inputs.label: Client Secret

inputs.comments: Provide the App ID from the Hubspot Developer Console.
inputs.label: App ID

inputs.comments: Provide the Developer API Key from the Hubspot Developer Console, if available.
inputs.label: Developer API Key

documentation.description:
The Hubspot component authenticates requests through a OAuth 2.0 credential.
Information on how to generate an OAuth 2.0 credential with Hubspot can be found [here](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth)
Now, you will have to configure a new Auth 2.0 Hubspot connection in Prismatic.

-   For **Client ID** and **Client Secret** enter the values that you got from the Hubspot auth settings.
-   For **Scopes** choose from the list found on the Hubspot [docs](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth)

connections.label: Private App Access Token
connections.comments: An access token generated when you create a private app. For testing purposes only - use OAuth 2.0 for production integrations.

inputs.comments: An access token generated when you create a private app. For testing purposes only - use OAuth 2.0 for production integrations.
inputs.label: Access Token

display.label: List Deals
display.description: Retrieve a list of all deals

inputs.comments: For each item, provide a property you would like to be returned in the response.
inputs.label: Additional Properties To Return

inputs.comments: For each item, provide an object type to retrieve the associated Ids for.
inputs.label: Associations List

inputs.comments: Whether to return only results that have been archived.
inputs.label: Return Archived Results

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Flipping this flag will enable the logging of the entire request, before it is sent to the Hubspot API.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: Provide a number for the maximum amount of items that will be returned by the search.
inputs.label: Limit

inputs.comments: Specify the pagination token that's returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results
inputs.label: Start After

display.label: Create Deal
display.description: Create a new deal

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the amount.
inputs.label: Amount

inputs.comments: Provide a date representing when the sale will close.
inputs.label: Close Date

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name of the deal
inputs.label: Deal Name

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the owner of the resource
inputs.label: Owner Id

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for which pipeline to interact with.
inputs.label: Pipeline

inputs.comments: Provide a value for the stage of the deal. Deal stages allow you to categorize and track the progress of the deals that you are working on.
inputs.label: Deal Stage

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for priority of the deal.
inputs.label: Priority

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the type of deal. By default, categorize your deal as either a New Business or Existing Business. The picklist of values for this property is configurable through Hubspot
inputs.label: Deal Type

inputs.comments: The names of the fields and their values to use when creating/updating a record. Hubspot allows you to configure many different properties to your CRM object. You can use this input to specify the key and value of any property that is not already in Prismatic.
inputs.label: Values

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Flipping this flag will enable the logging of the entire request, before it is sent to the Hubspot API.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: Provide a value for the unique identifier of the second object
inputs.label: To Id

inputs.label: Type Of Association

inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/crm/v3/objects/deals), The base URL is already included (https://api.hubapi.com). For example, to connect to https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals, only /crm/v3/objects/deals is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.placeholder: The file name to apply to a file
inputs.comments: File names to apply to the file data inputs. Keys must match the file data keys above.
inputs.label: File Data File Names

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description:
[Hubspot](https://www.hubspot.com/) is a Customer Relationship Management software for inbound marketing, sales, and customer service.
This component allows you to interact with the Hubspot REST API.
documentation.dev:
Documentation for Hubspot's REST API used in this component can be found at https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/overview.

:::tip
If a Hubspot API endpoint doesn't have a corresponding action within this component, you can leverage the [Raw Request](#raw-request) action to make a request to any Hubspot API endpoint.
:::
